intro: Ranunculus macrorhizus, commonly known as the large-rooted buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It features a distinctive yellow flower with five to eight petals, typically surrounded by a ring of sepals. The plant has a thick, fleshy root system that helps it survive in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a rough, hairy texture. It is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
